meanings.definition: A tool with a heavy metal head mounted across a handle, used for chopping wood.
meanings.sent1: Dad used the sharp axe to chop firewood for the fireplace.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjack swung the axe skillfully to fell the tree.
meanings.sent3: The axe was so eager to chop wood that it jumped out of the shed!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a sharp axe, cutting through the silence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming axe gleefully awaited its next task of splitting logs.

meanings.definition: To remove or dismiss someone or something abruptly or ruthlessly.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to axe the old project to focus on new goals.
meanings.sent2: She had to axe her plans for the weekend due to unexpected work.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to axe the noisy student from the class.
meanings.sent4: His decision to axe the partnership surprised everyone in the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The manager had to axe the underperforming employee to improve team efficiency.

meanings.definition: To reduce or remove something drastically.
meanings.sent1: The company had to axe its budget to survive the financial crisis.
meanings.sent2: She decided to axe unnecessary expenses from her monthly budget.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to axe some ingredients from the recipe due to shortages.
meanings.sent4: The government had to axe certain programs to allocate funds to more critical areas.
meanings.sent5: The editor had to axe several paragraphs to meet the word count limit.
